de.lmu.ifi.mfa

Interface IFlowNetwork

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FlowNetwork

    public interface IFlowNetwork
    The IFlowNetwork interface represents a flow network consisting of a directed graph of vertices. It supports the following two primary functionalities: create and manipulate a flow network, evaluate the maximum flow on the network.

    The interface provides methods to add and remove vertices or edges as well as methods to set source and sink vertex. It contains two methods that implement Dinic's and Goldberg-Tarjan's maximum flow algorithms to compute the maximum flow in O(n²m) and O(n³) time, respectively.

    Additionally, there are methods to save and load the flow network. Furthermore, the interface provides methods to query data about the current state of the flow network in order to connect a graphical user interface.

    For additional information, see MFA by Christian Gebhardt on Github.

    Since:
    2016-09-03
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Christian Gebhardt

    • Method Detail

      • addVertex

        void addVertex(int vertexId)
        Add a vertex to the graph of the flow network. When the vertex already exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier. It has to be non-negative integer, otherwise it shows a failure message.

      • removeVertex

        void removeVertex(int vertexId)
        Remove a vertex from the graph of the flow network. When the vertex has incoming and outgoing edges, all the adjacent edges are also removed.
        Parameters:
        vertexId - the vertex identifier. It has to be non-negative integer that exists in the graph, otherwise it shows a failure message.

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(int vertexId1,
             int vertexId2,
             int capacity)
        Add an edge to the graph of the flow network. When the edge already exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge. When the vertex not already exists, it is added to the graph.
        capacity - the maximum flow capacity of the edge. It has to be a positive integer, otherwise it shows a failure message.

      • removeEdge

        void removeEdge(int vertexId1,
                int vertexId2)
        Remove an edge from the graph of the flow network. The adjacent vertices are untouched. When the edge does not exists, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        vertexId1 - the start vertex identifier of the edge.
        vertexId2 - the end vertex identifier of the edge.

      • setSource

        void setSource(int sourceId)
        Specify a vertex to be the source of the flow network. When the vertex does not exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the source vertex identifier. It has to be a valid identifier in the graph.

      • getSource

        int getSource()
        Return the identifier of the specified source vertex of the flow network. When the source is not specified it returns -1.
        Returns:
        the source vertex identifier of the graph.

      • setSink

        void setSink(int sinkId)
        Specify a vertex to be the sink of the flow network. When the vertex does not exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        sinkId - the sink vertex identifier. It has to be a valid identifier in the graph.

      • getSink

        int getSink()
        Return the identifier of the specified sink vertex of the flow network. When the sink is not specified it returns -1.
        Returns:
        the sink vertex identifier of the graph.

      • dinic

        int dinic()
        Calculate and return the maximum flow with Dinic's augmenting path algorithm. This method calculates one solution for the maximum flow in O(n²m) time and updates the flow in the network to this maximum flow.
        Returns:
        the maximum flow of the flow network.

      • goldbergTarjan

        int goldbergTarjan()
        Calculate and return the maximum flow with Goldberg-Tarjan's push-relabel algorithm. This method calculates one solution for the maximum flow in O(n³) time and updates the flow in the network to this maximum flow.
        Returns:
        the maximum flow of the flow network.

      • resetNetwork

        void resetNetwork()
        Reset the flow network to an empty network.This method removes all edges and vertices from the graph to reset the flow network to the initial state.

      • saveNetwork

        void saveNetwork(java.io.File file)
        Save the flow network to a file. This method saves the total topology of the flow network with the current state of the flow to the file system. Therefore, it uses a special file format *.mfa. When a failure arises, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to save the flow network.
        See Also:
        File

      • loadNetwork

        void loadNetwork(java.io.File file)
        Load a flow network from a file. This method load a previously saved flow network with the current state of the flow from a special *.mfa file. When the file is not found, or another failure arises, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to load the flow network.
        See Also:
        File

      • getPrompt

        java.lang.String getPrompt()
        Return status information about the last operations. This method can be used from UIs to provide control information to the user. It returns success messages, failure notification and help information
        Returns:
        message with status information about the last operations

      • displayFlowNetwork

        java.lang.String displayFlowNetwork()
        Return a String with the current state of the flow network. This method can be used to display the flow network in text format. It contains the source and sink vertex identifiers the maximum flow and a list of all vertices with their adjacent lists of edges.
        Returns:
        current state of the flow network in text format.

      • getGraphData

        java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer[]> getGraphData()
        Return a list of all edges. This method adds all edges as four tuple of Integer[] (start vertex, end vertex, capacities, flows) to a LinkedList.
        Returns:
        list of all edges in the graph of the flow network.

      • getVertexIndices

        java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> getVertexIndices()
        Return a list of all vertices. This method adds all vertex identifiers as Integer to a LinkedList.
        Returns:
        list of all vertices in the graph of the flow network.

      • updateGraph

        void updateGraph()
        Update the graph after a change. Set a flag that the status of the graph has changed and inform all components of the program about this change.

      • isUpdateGraph

        boolean isUpdateGraph()
        Return the status, if the flow network has changed. This method allows other program components to query the status of the flow network.
        Returns:
        status of the flow network, if it has changed.

      • drawGraph

        void drawGraph()
        Redraw the graph after a change. Set a flag that the topology of the graph has changed and inform all components of the program about this change.

      • isDrawGraph

        boolean isDrawGraph()
        Return the status, if the graph topology has changed. This method allows other program components to query, if they have to redraw the graph.
        Returns:
        status of the graph topology, if it has changed.
